intro: Legousia speculum, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its silver-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. Legousia speculum is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
